website_summaries.verdict: Designed to offer barehand sensitivity while still providing protection. Perfect for those who lose finger sensitivity while wearing gardening gloves.
pros: Ideal for delicate jobs that require full dexterity
Made of breathable bamboo with a tough nitrile coating on the palm side
We love that these gloves are touchscreen friendly
Flexible and seamless, so they don't irritate skin
cons: Not tough enough to prevent punctures, so they're not suitable for use with roses or cacti

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ive gone through MANY gardening gloves. These literally fell apart after using 4 times. Maybe the good ratings are for someone who holds a garden rake once in awhile, but if you're doing REAL yard work like digging or pruning they won't last. The rubbery surface started wearing off immediately and now today they ripped completely. Literally wore them 4 times.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Riley McMuscle

customer_reviews.title: Gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. Great quality. Fits snugly. Update: After trying to wear them while working, I have found that they actually fit too snugly, the sizing is rather small. I am sorry to say that I returning them because they are too small for comfort, I should have bought the larger size. So if you think you wear a large maybe you should try the XL. However, the larger is even too tight for my wife who of coarse has much smaller hand than me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble finding gloves that fit my tiny little hands. I can't work when I have an extra inch of finger tip flopping around at the end of my glove. I ordered these in medium, and they're perfect. They helped me tear up a plot of land by hand. The gloves have held up really well, with no signs of excessive wear. I'd buy them again. Update 7/29/18: Finally wore a hole in one of the gloves. I was weeding the curb and sidewalk cracks, so I think it's from scraping against the pavement. It's such a small hole that I'll probably continue to use them for a while, but I'll be ordering another pair. I love these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I used them for stocking may be great for gardening
customer_reviews.text: Had for short time nitrile coating is to thin.I used them for stocking may be great for gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trust me these are the better choice.
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the gardening gloves that are not the Honey Badger Garden Gloves For Digging & Planting these have worked the best for me. I can get a month out of these gloves. I order 2 pairs at a time. Don't buy any other "me too" like kind gloves...order these.
customer_reviews.author: mimi2212

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves--buy these
customer_reviews.text: Snug fit, very dextrous, feel very protected from wet soil and yard debris (probably not thorns--haven't pushed it). Really love these gloves for gardening and even for light construction (sanding wood). Grip is really good and helps me get my hands 'dirty' when I don't really feel like it. No need for a nail brush after gardening with these gloves. I have tiny-baby-hands and they fit me great/snugly. I'm sure there's a little room at the finger tips but nothing that has annoyed me. I can literally wear kid-size gloves or size xs womens.
customer_reviews.author: Delayed Gratification

customer_reviews.title: Terrible!
customer_reviews.text: My husband used these to drag already cut tiny trees into our backyard. He put them on, said that they felt strong, dragged one tree 50 feet into our backyard, and returned with a tear in the glove just from grasping the trunk of the tree and dragging this lightweight (no more than 2 pounds) 50 feet! They ripped between the thumb and the palm of one's hand. This is far too much to charge for a one time use glove!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Rae

customer_reviews.title: So good, and comfortable I might have to stop buying $3 and cheaper pairs.
customer_reviews.text: I suppose a lot of people are like I am when it comes to this kind of nitrile glove; I buy quite a few pairs, even though they actually last forever a lot of times. These Bamboo gloves are soft and comfortable in the fabric, but durable as heck. The nitrile is about as thick as you'd want it, and still be able to handle things like paper money, or a notebook with some fingertip feeling (fingerspitzengefuehl?). I am usually on the hunt for nitrile work gloves that cost $3 a pair or less. With these, I am going to have to rethink my strattegy. They are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Buy these. They're awesome.
customer_reviews.text: These are "hands down" the best gloves I've ever purchased, borrowed or used. Tree branches and other debris, cleaning, grip, these gloves are comfortable, easy to work in and your hands don't feel a thing. They're fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This tore at the seam upon second use. I would not recomend this product
customer_reviews.author: Tflick

customer_reviews.title: Loved these at first
customer_reviews.text: Loved these at first. It's hard to find gloves that both aren't bulky and fit my smaller hands. These managed to check both of those boxes and I was thrilled! Alas, I think I garden too hard for these. After only having them for just about a month, the coating on the palms is already starting to fall apart. Also, the coating split between my pointer finger and my thumb on my right hand. Luckily the glove itself is still intact, but without the coating I don't think these are long for this world. I'm crushed. Back to the drawing board to find a good pair of gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica N.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gloves for Gardening
customer_reviews.text: My husband would never wear gloves while doing his extensive gardening and his hands paid the price. I got him these gloves and he seldom takes them off while working outside! They are comfortable and protect him from dirt and minor scratches, though rose thorns are still a problem, plus they've lasted the whole summer. A wonderful pair of gloves that I borrowed once to cut wild grapevines, and I love them now too.
customer_reviews.author: C. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Too tight between thumb and index. Not for people with long fingers.
customer_reviews.text: The area between thumb and index is too tight. When you open the hand, stretching your palm open, you feel resistance. It's like when they manufacture these gloves they dip them with palms relaxed. I wonder how dipping them while palms stretched open would change the performance. Obviously it wouldn't have the resistance issue, but maybe when the fist is closed there's extra material that would bother the user, but extra material there could be plus because that area tends to tear first. It doesn't hurt to make the experiment. When it's improved I'm buying me another pair. I like these, but that tightness, although present on almost all of these nitrile gloves, in this one is exaggerated.
customer_reviews.author: MJNV

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and breathable
customer_reviews.text: Other reviewers suggested these run small, so although I generally wear a medium, I purchased the Large. It was a good call. I found these held up well doing yard work and weed pulling. The rubberized part did not leak, but the mesh part is not water resistant and loose dirt will work in with the mesh. The rubberized part did protect my hands, gave me good gripping surface and my hands did not sweat inside like they do with cheaper versions. I hand wash and hang dry. They have lasted through many wearings and washings. So far they are worth the money and I would probably purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: J Edgar

customer_reviews.title: just what i had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: i have a hard time finding work gloves that actually work for my small, chubby hands. but these size S fit perfectly -- no trouble getting them on or off and my fingers fit right to the tip. i wore them for several hours as i pulled weeds , removed annuals and veggie plants, and planted my bulbs. i found them easy to work with - flexible and with excellent grip. no, they will not prevent a thorn from getting through and they can be cut if your shears slip, but they kept my hands relatively safe and perfectly clean! i really like them and will probably order a back-up pair.
customer_reviews.author: Moneypitt

customer_reviews.title: Very good garden gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have all these prickly thistles in my yard and these gloves work great pulling them out of the ground, I do not get pricked by thistle thorns, and i can grab them and pull them up by the root, because this hangs on to them so well. I also used them pruning my rose bush and again, did not get pricked! WOW!!! I do not think i will ever use anything else! Oh and they fit perfect! I did not know if it was a men's size or women's. I am a large tall woman with big hands so I ordered a medium, and they fit me perfect. Must be men's sizing!
customer_reviews.author: Lea Opitz

customer_reviews.title: THEY ARE AMAZING and so durable
customer_reviews.text: I had some thorny bushes in the yard that I needed to weed out and my regular gardening gloves weren't doing the job (the thorns punctured the gloves), so I searched on Amazon for something a bit more durable. Eventually, I found these little gems. They arrived in the mail quickly, and I got right to work in the yard. THEY ARE AMAZING and so durable. I love them! They kept all of those bothersome thorns out of the way. I love that they come up on my wrist to provide extra protection. I highly recommend these gloves to other garden lovers out there.
customer_reviews.author: Bean & PeanutTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these gloves. I have longer fingers than usual. bigger gloves are annoying. many are uncomfortable. I have a TERRIBLE time ordering gardening gloves. I couldn't go anywhere to even try them on & be disappointed. I ordered them online thinking, I am a glutton for punishment. When I first looked at them, I thought, "oh dear, they do look a bit small... but I tried them on & WOW. Turns out these are more comfortable gloves I've ever had. They are decently sturdy, but not getting in the way of my using them. I LOVE these gloves! Where have these been all my life?
customer_reviews.author: Taraxacom

customer_reviews.title: Good glove but fabric could be stronger
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. I have more feel of whatever I'm touching than with heavy, leather gardening gloves. The rubbery palm side gives you a good grip. The fabric back has to make them less hot to wear, but I tore a small hole in the top side, fabric side, of one of the fingers with my fingernail. They continue to be wearable and very useful; I just take a bit more care putting them on. I'd recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Simmons

customer_reviews.title: GARDENING, GARDEN GLOVES, LANDSCAPING
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are light-to-average weight. They seem a bit small as they fit my hands without the fingertips folding over. My hands don't get too sweaty while wearing them. However, I gave the gloves only four stars because of their small size. I also have a VERY prickly rosebush that I'm trying to remove and these gloves are no match for something that unfriendly. Only something like a blowtorch or a lightning strike will put an end to that beast. The good news is that I can CAREFULLY handle Ocotillo using the gloves so it's not all bad.
customer_reviews.author: Three Doggies

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR WEEDING
customer_reviews.text: After 5 hours of working outside hole in the right thumb and ruined manicure. These are nice gloves but not for weeding which is the reason I purchased them. The fit was excellent and comfortable. My hands did not sweat. These would be great gloves if the tip were much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Donna DiFrancesco

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Garden Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent gloves. I had been putting off gloves to garden for a while, but after making 100 gallons of soil and cleaning that out of my fingernail I’ll never do it again. I looking on Amazon to find these beauties. The large fit perfect to my hand, 7 1/4” from base palm to tip of middle finger and 3 1/4” width of palm. They are easily wash and dried with water but can be difficult to take off due to the rubber coated fingers and palm. They are fantastic and indefinitely feel better knowing my hands will be cut free and a little less dirty!
customer_reviews.author: Brice Thrasher

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made Gloves!! 🧤
customer_reviews.text: Worst gloves ever!! I had high hopes for these gloves because they’re natural bamboo and not toxic with the Prop. 65 cancer warning like the other gloves, but they SUCK!! They ripped after only wearing them 5 times!! I only used them to water my plants, clean cobwebs and pick up pieces of wood!! WTF!? They’re NOT waterproof at all either! They get soaking wet and make your hands sweaty NOT “cool and dry.” Nothing “cool” about these poorly made gloves, so save your $15 they’re NOT even worth $5!! Seriously!!
customer_reviews.author: E. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: These are terrible. Started developing holes in them after several uses ...
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible. Started developing holes in them after several uses doing light yard work. Look for something else more durable.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these the other day and I put them to tough use yesterday. They fit me perfectly (I have small hands) and I could feel enough through them to tell if I was pulling a weed or the plant roots. They protected my hands perfectly and my fingers felt nimble enough to use micro pruning shears, plus my hands didn't get sweaty. They got really muddy so I washed them with my hands still in under the garden hose, laid them out to air dry and they are good to go. If they fall apart in the near future I will update my review but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra B. T.

customer_reviews.title: Not for real gardeners.
customer_reviews.text: These were better than some gloves I have had. I got these on Apr 12 and now on May 23, 6 weeks and not used every day and they are shot. These held up better than some I have had, but I still have many more months of gardening left in the season. One finger is completely worn out. These are fine for occassional use or using with rakes/shovels, but are not good for someone that is digging in the dirt trying to pull out weeds. On a good note, they are very comfortable. Is there a warranty to these? Oh, I am sure there is not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this pair of gloves since the description says that it's durable and built to last. It didn't!! I used it to do garneing works and it didn't last 2 weeks (total work time: not even 48 hours). Like other reviews say, the rubber part around the fingers developed holes very quickly. It fit snuggly and seemed cool to work in, but definitely not durable. After this pair gave out (after 2 weeks), I went to Home Depot to get another pair for half the price and it has much much much better strength and durability so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not intended for real gardeners
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for daughter who works full time in a nursery. She is constantly pruning and spraying the plants with water. Her gloves wore through at the joint of the thumb and hand from the constant squeezing of the tools she uses. The waterproofing went out the door once the material wore through. The gloves lasted less than 10 days. She was very excited to use these as her hands are always in water, however these did not work for her.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Bert

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed My Expectations!! Perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: I actually LOVE, LOVE, LOVE these gloves!! Bought the size small and they fit PERFECTLY! I would say they "fit like a glove" but they are supposed to lol. I LOVE how I can use these and actually have a good grip on things I am trying to hold (avoiding another pun there). When I got mine dirty I just ran them through soapy water and let dry on a chair outside. These gloves are WONDERFUL!! I am using them daily to plant my container garden and I just LOVE them! Best garden gloves I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.author: Caren G.

customer_reviews.title: Best weeding gloves I have had
customer_reviews.text: Most gardening gloves I have used were bulky and I had difficulty doing things with my fingertips. These gloves are the closest thing to being barehanded that I have found with the exception of plain latex gloves that don't really protect your hands and are single use. I like that the backs can breath so that my hands don't get sweaty. The rubber fronts keep my hands clean and dry. They are also easy to clean. I found sizing to be difficult. I guess I am between two sizes and cannot comment on durability as have had them only a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Seibel

customer_reviews.title: Good glove but not for heavy duty work
customer_reviews.text: I like this glove but I tend to do a lot of clearing/digging with my hands while gardening and doing yard work, and the material on the fingertips just breaks down. But, if used for a little lighter duty work, I think that these gloves would be awesome. Update: After using these gloves for a while, they just aren't holding up very well. In addition to the fingertips developing holes, the coating on the palms is rubbing off. For the price, I would expect a more durable product.
customer_reviews.author: CalBee

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and flexible!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these a few times now and I really like them. They're the perfect size for my lady hands, comfy and snug. I've used them for gardening and weed-pulling and they allow for great flexibility. I've also used them to mix concrete by hand and they cleaned up well. I'm happy!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Andryshak

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last
customer_reviews.text: The coated fingers didn't last. Wore holes in finger tips on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Pine Tree Tools Bamboo Working Gloves - Fit Like a Glove
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for any type of work. I actually ordered a the XXL's this time as my old XL's were well worn from use & abuse and I'm very pleased with the XXL fit. I use them when doing any type of gardening work because of the fit and flexibility they afford. Especially useful when cleaning out the mower deck with the wet grass this year - we've had a lot of rain and even on a sunny day, the grass clogs the mower. The saying "fits like a glove" is very appropriate for these as they feel like a second skin allowing my big hands to grab and manipulate things that regular stiff gloves won't. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nemo1948

customer_reviews.title: Torn after just a few uses
customer_reviews.text: These were fine while they lasted, but they didn’t last long at all. Both gloves formed sizable holes at the base of the thumb near the palm, right where you need the most protection while weeding.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K

customer_reviews.title: Game of Thorns
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gardening gloves in January. I figured they would not be put to the test until Spring. Because of warm weather I decided to tackle a briar ridden garden area I planned to reclaim. These gloves worked great! I work carefully around briars but am clumsy enough that I usually suffer from multiple thorn pricks. These gloves gave me enough protection that there was no blood spilled. They are comfortable. Although the rest of me was covered in mud, my hands were clean. I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: gingergal

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are the best garden gloves I have used so far. They are strong, comfy, and strong !! I am not a casual gardener, I really USE my gloves; I can go thru a pair of gloves in 1 day. To me there is nothing worse than taking off your gloves and all your fingertips are dirty. Not with these. I've been using them now since I got them, maybe a week or two, and no dirt, Still totally intact, no holes. Like I said LOVE THESE GLOVES !!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Like nitrile gloves -- single use
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: the moment I put on the glove, I could see the blue material tearing as I grabbed a shovel and began digging. Shortly after the 15 minute attempt to move dirt, the fabric (green) had worn through at an odd space: between thumb and index finger, as well a smaller starter hole between pinky & ring fingers (where a seam might have been in a sewn glove). Tossed within 30 minutes of opening the package. Just like my nitrile gloves!
customer_reviews.author: David Jackemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Garden Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves for my son because I got tired of him taking mine all the time. He really put these gloves to the test and used them when weeding, trimming trees and bushes and digging and who knows what else. They have held up and no holes. My son's hands are large [imagine him wearing my medium gloves when he works] and I ordered the large ones for him and they fit him just fine. He liked it that his hands were clean when done with the work. I will watch and when he wears these out, I will definitely buy him another pair. That is the least a mother can do.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Best Gardening Gloves I’ve Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: I used them for a few consecutive hours today, weeding, mowing etc. I noticed when I was taking them off there’s a small rip between the thumb and index finger. Not big, but still it’s kind of lame. Still like these gloves though. These gloves are by far the best gardening gloves I’ve ever gotten. I’ve only had them a month or so, but damn. Thorny bushes and roses, not a problem. My hands don’t get ripped to shreds. 4 star on the water only because your hands are going to get wet if you get the fabric part wet. All in all, definitely a recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable while wearing.  Very easy to move in
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy I can move in these. I can grab things and cut and it hardly feels like I have them on. One thing though if you want something that thorns or pickers won't go through these aren't so good. Don't get me wrong. I love these but pickers will go through " Great communication with seller. Very concerned about my satisfaction. Would buy from again "
customer_reviews.author: soliver

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for small hands. Good gripping.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third pair. They really don't last as long as I'd like. I do really like these, though, as I have small hands with short fingers. Other gloves don't fit properly which makes it difficult to pull weeds and do other gardening chores. I really like the grip I get with these. They have some kind of rubberized palms and fingers with the back just material, so they breath a little. They are not waterproof, but I don't need that. They are easy to wash. I just leave them on my hands to wash them then put them on the patio to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Vampire Reader 5

customer_reviews.title: WOW these are unique garden gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality gloves. They're not bulky or thick. The best feature is the material is very stretchy, and clings to my hands, and lets me feel what I'm doing. Sizing is a bit off. According to their chart I should have ordered the small gloves, but I ordered the medium. Small might have been a little tight I think. I like the rubbery layer for gripping things. These are very non-traditional garden gloves and they are a big improvement over others!
customer_reviews.author: CarolynnTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and practical gardening gloves
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am so glad these fit my weird hands! I have short stubby fingers and giant palms and the size I ordered fit perfectly! These are also very comfortable to wear and have a great grip. I used them to pull some thick weeds out in the backyard. I was able to do so with no issues! My only criticism is that they can be a little hard to take off because there is so much of that grippy material that they can almost "stick" together... but that's obviously such a minor issue for an otherwise great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Sensitive Protection
customer_reviews.text: My thin hand skin bleeds with a minor bump. The Pine Tree gloves give me great protection for my hands and allow me to do the finer jobs requiring sensitivity (sounds like a condom) such as gardening, cleaning, minor mechanics, handling variety of materials. Sizing was tricky. The first pair was too small for me so I gave those to my 90 year old mother and ordered the next size up. Barring my research shows a better glove when they, I'll replace these with another pair from Pine Tree.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've had the gloves for garden work and wear them every other day. I'm an adult male, 6'3 in stature and and 220 lbs. I have large hands and would recommend the xxl. After several uses, the logo/text begin to dramatically fade and the rubber coating (?) palm side begins to rub and tear after a while. I can still use them for light soil and yard work but was hoping to get more out of them. 4/5.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically to pull prickly weeds from our gardens. Well, the prickers went through. I could feel them as I worked, and I could feel the prickers even after I had stopped pulling weeds. I have itchy red hands. These gloves were a waste of money. I threw them away, partly because, if I ever used them again I would have to deal with the pricker embedded in them.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jeffrey Schnitzer

customer_reviews.title: Ordered more - my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my 1st pair a couple years ago and then just ordered 2 more this year. Great durability. I love the rubber for a good grip and to avoid wet/muddy water to get in. No blisters or dirt under my nails so its a win for me.
customer_reviews.author: sarita

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening, and Work Glove !
customer_reviews.text: These gloves slip on like a second skin , and keep hands protected while doing all garden work. Never bulky or in the way while weeding around delicate flowers. Easy to wash ! Just wash your hands with gloves ON, and dry overnight. Great rubber grips for gathering green waste and any recyclable cardboard as well. I use them for everything !
customer_reviews.author: Christy Continued

customer_reviews.title: which makes it very easy in which to work
customer_reviews.text: Glove stretches, thus, fits snugly over hand, which makes it very easy in which to work. I ordered this first pair for my husband, then ordered one for myself. I use it every time I work outdoors and it's lasted well, except that the cuff has lost some of its elasticity; however, it's still useable. I have ordered two additional pairs, just to have on hand. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: works well, comfy, reasonably durable
customer_reviews.text: these work a lot better than I expected, and have outlasted several sets cheap gloves from HD I used for weeding. They're nicely waterproof for light use; fingers and palm are totally waterproof, more than enough for muddy weeding. Thin enough to get small weeds, yet durable. The rubbery band at the cuff irritates my skin, but good waterproof gloves that last and aren't too bulky are totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: FBT

customer_reviews.title: Best Garden gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: I Love these gloves. I live in the mountains and am rough on gloves. I use these for every task. In fact I bought a second pair immediately after receiving the first. I didn’t want to be without them. My hands are small and these gloves fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lljones

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality
customer_reviews.text: These were ordered as a Mother's Day gift in April of 2017. My Mother absolutely loves these gloves and is still using them until this day, April 2nd, 2019, and she works in her gardens almost every day. They are very high quality, obviously, to have held up for going on 2 years without ripping, tearing, or rubbing holes in them. They are still in fair condition today. Excellent product, I would have to say! Her Birthday is coming up April 8th of this month and another pair of these will make a great addition to some other gardening items I've purchased for her birthday this year! Thanks again and great Product! Sincerely, John Johnson
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and protective but coating already cracking
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and DO protect my hands. I ordered two pairs, one for myself and another for a family member. Unless I can find a more durable product I will likely order more. I also like that they’re made of bamboo. What I don’t like: The coating in which they’re dipped is already cracking. We’re avid, busy gardeners and these ate not holding up as well as I’d hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Hklbrries

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves look great, fit great and are very comfortable. I find that these are prices higher than other similar gloves on the market, but felt that would be worth it given the solid reviews. Unfortunately they just do not hold up to average gardening tasks. Within a couple weeks the gripping material starting falling off in joint areas. Shortly after they developed holes in multiple fingertips. I would not recommend these at all for gardening.
customer_reviews.author: E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves initially but didn’t last long.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed great and just what my husband needed. He’s always doing yard work and he doesn’t like the way regular gloves restrict him/are too bulky, so he wouldn’t wear gloves and his hands would always be so dirty. I got these for him for Father’s Day and he loved them. He wore them right away and they were great. UNTIL, a month later they got holes in them. So they didn’t stand up to the job. He was working with rocks and plants but still nothing I thought the gloves couldn’t handle. We were disappointed they got holes in them so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Rita  Kelly

customer_reviews.title: They fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: Well-made. I liked them enough to buy a second pair for myself and my daughter. Cons: A lot of dirt gets in. I need to scrub with a nail brush. EDIT 6/2019: This season I've been using another pair I'd lost in storage 3 years ago. The rubber is thick and not porous so my hands/nails are still clean when I remove them. These are good for light work but not digging or handling soil. They're comfortable regardless.
customer_reviews.author: MyAmazonUserName

customer_reviews.title: Can they weed for me?
customer_reviews.text: Only thing that would make these gloves better is if they did the weeding for me. Seriously - comfy & durable. I had some MONSTER weeds in my yard (oops). No pokes, no cuts, and shockingly - no blisters.
customer_reviews.author: HRS

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: The wrist area is very tight for the XL size. I’d like the black accent color to be another color, more natural, like a tan or yellow. Otherwise, I’m quite satisfied with the product, and right away ordered a second pair. Will try to update after more use. UPDATE: THE FINGERTIPS RIPPED AFTER ONE MONTH OF GENERAL GARDEN USE ON ONE OF THE PAIR. THE WRIST AREA IS STILL TOO TIGHT, AND IT DOES NOT PROTECT YOUR HANDS FROM THE SUN. I CAN FEEL THE SUNBURN THROUGH THE FABRIC. I DON’T RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Y.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Very comfortable and fits snuggly. Used mines to trim my roses, dig holes in the dirt, and pick up branches. I’ve had them for about 2 months now and they’ve held up well. The palm part of the glove hasn’t cracked, torn or peeled. They’re very flexible. UPDATE: it’s now 8 months later and the rubber grip parts have cracked. It’s only on the finger joint areas, where it bends most. They are still very usable but when I replace these in the future, I would probably look for something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie21

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, protects my nails
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit! I wear a medium so that’s what I ordered. The gloves are snug but not too tight. I like the fit because t it doesn’t interfere with dexterity. The glove has a waterproof “rubber” treatment on the underside and over the fingernails which adds protection for my manicure. The top of the glove is a stretchy fabric- not waterproof but keeps the dirt off my hands. I don’t mind if it gets wet- much better than having to wear gloves that are fully rubberized! I’m buying a second pair- highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen S

customer_reviews.title: Large hands? Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: My hands aren't THAT big. I know guys with bigger mitts. But according to the chart, the XXL gloves I bought should have been an easy, possibly slightly roomy, fit. Nope. Squeeze and stretch. I can get them on, but they still pinch and constrict. I know that after a few hours work in the garden, I'll be tearing them off. I'll keep looking. Anybody know a brand of glove that doesn't make you feel like you're putting on Michelle Pfeiffer's rubber Cat Woman suit?
customer_reviews.author: waiting... waiting

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are "hands down", pun intended, the best gardening gloves I have ever worn. Foolishly, I put in raised beds all around my house and throughout the yard. While they are beautiful when they are "done", they take quite a bit of upkeep--a solid 2 weeks, nights and weekends, every spring to remove all of the weeds, leaves, and mulch replaced. As a result, I have gone through several pairs of gloves because I have a tendency to put down my trowel and just dig with my fingers. The fabric feels good on my hands. I don't have torn/ broken nails or holes in the finger tips after a solid 2 days of weeding and mulching. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya in MO

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Excellent Fit, and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are very well made. The elasticity in their construction makes it easy for me to slip them on over the swollen arthritic joints of my hands. I love that they are ‘form fitting’ and light weight. However, I do have one concern. worn them when working in yard and flower beds for only 4-5 days. I’ve noted that the ‘rubber’ surface is already looking a bit worn and pitted but up to this point it is still intact. At this time I would say the gloves are well worth the cost and I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Veronia M. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Best. Gloves. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I've always preferred latex dipped cotton gloves for gardening and work around the house, but I'm so glad I tried these bamboo gloves! No matter what kind of project I need to tackle, these gloves keep my hands clean, but also provide breathability. My hands don't sweat as much as they do in other gloves, and I love that I get more of a "bare hand" feel while working. Bonus that they're touchscreen friendly! I highly recommend these gloves for any kind of house or yard work.
customer_reviews.author: JSmith

customer_reviews.title: You can use your cell phone with these on!
customer_reviews.text: I measured my hand and based on the description bought a medium, and they fit perfectly. Most gloves have extra room in the fingertips which makes it harder to work. A great bonus is I can use my cell phone with these gloves on. I've never been able to do that with other garden gloves. I have only had them a week, so time will tell if they hold up better than others, but for now I couldn't be happier. These are well worth the price if you use gloves often and want to function as though you don't have gloves on at all.
customer_reviews.author: BZRanch

customer_reviews.title: It Snugs well to your hands
customer_reviews.text: I mostly use this product for gardening. I like that it snugs well to your hands, it grips well also. Good protection for your hands. You can actually work like your not wearing any gloves, it wont bother you at hall. Its a really great product. It breaks down after a lot of use, especially when your using a lot of tools and applying a lot of force while using it but still I'm really satisfied with this product. I might buy another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: yanxter

customer_reviews.title: They run small so make sure to check the sizing chart
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent gloves and I would hold back one star since they run small but the seller was very helpful getting the size correct for me. If you buy these make sure to look through all of the seller's photos, there is one of the photos which has a sizing chart that will help you to know which size you should order. Keep in mind that the gloves do stretch a bit but using the sizing chart definitely will help. If you have really large hands then even the extra large size in these gloves will probably not work, that would probably be the only downside to these great gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Mike T.

customer_reviews.title: Great dexterity
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect if you want to still be able to use your fingers for dextrous work while gardening. I'm able to grip weeds well and yank them out after loosening their roots with a trowel. I have small hands, and the small size fits well. I'm on my second pair because they do eventually wear out. But I get at least a year of use out of each pair. The rubberized palms are nice protection, but it's still possible to stab yourself with a rose thorn. So if you need protection from thorns, you'll want something heavier duty than these. But overall I'm very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: RJWeaver

customer_reviews.title: I'll be lucky if they last the season...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the reviews touted the great fit and durabilty. They do fit my hands (like a glove) to the point that they feel like 2nd skin. Problem is, it's May (I've had them 2 months) and there is a hole in the stretchy portion between my finger and thumb, palm side. This also means they are no longer water resistant. Maybe my hands pull too much in this area? Maybe I should get a bigger size next time and risk them being too big?
customer_reviews.author: Sheena Enslow

customer_reviews.title: Beware and DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: Today was the first time I used these gardening gloves. After pulling weeds for an hour, my nails when right through the flimsy rubber fingers. Over the years, I have bought many pair of gardening gloves and never experienced this issue. Do yourself a favor, buy a good pair at your local home improvement store and DO NOT PURCHASE THESE.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Pollard

customer_reviews.title: the most comfortable garden gloves I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I wear them backwards with the rubber on the inside and the mesh on the outside because I wanted more protection for my hand when pruning and weeding. My hands get a little dirtier but they never get poked by stickers. Because there is strong cloth/mesh on one side they breathe easily and I don't het that hands in a sauna feel when using them.
customer_reviews.author: Meerkatsrock

customer_reviews.title: Great At First...Deteriorated Quickly
customer_reviews.text: For the first three weeks that I used these gloves they were great and I was very happy with my purchase. After that time, however, the rubber on the palms began to deteriorate after normal, backyard gardening(a little shoveling and digging). Very disappointed in the lack of durability when they had seemed like they would be my "go to" brand for the future...unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves and perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: Though I haven't used these much yet, I did want to review the size/fit. I am a female with size 8 ring finger. Since my fingers are bigger than that of many women, I wasn't sure if Medium glove would work. They are a perfect fit (if a tiny bit short in the fingers). That is better than having extra glove at the tips of the fingers. The quality looks great and seems to be a bit better than similar gloves at the big box store down the road.
customer_reviews.author: MizPosey

customer_reviews.title: Protect your hands while doing your outdoor chores!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent outdoor gloves for ladies especially if you work with pine sap or anything with pickers/thorns. I like these for the durability and keeping my hands sap and sticky free and also preventing scratches. Nothing really came through at all and preventing my nails from looking like I’ve been digging for grubs all day is a plus. They stay dry and don’t get hot and sweaty even in dead of summer.
customer_reviews.author: Melacha

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these gloves with a leap of faith, based on the reviews. I don't do heavy gardening stuff, some digging with a pickaxe, taking out plants from pots and planting them in the hole, and then the usual lawn mowing. These gloves are fabric (?) and some soft of a latex covering on the inside of the gloves. This has made the gloves so nimble, and they are great for gently taking out plants from the pots, and then transplanting them carefully, with the rootball intact. I am fairly impressed, esp at this price point. AND THE MOST IMPORTANT POINT. THEY ARE MADE IN KOREA, NOT CHINA!
customer_reviews.author: D. Godavarty

customer_reviews.title: First impression was great. Great use for two months, but didn't last.
customer_reviews.text: Upon first using these gloves I was very impressed- they were extremely comfortable and seemed perfect for my gardening needs. I used them heavily on two occasions to dig holes and move dirt to plant a couple of fifteen gallon trees, and later to move heavy logs from a dead birch tree. It has been less than two months since purchasing and, sadly , the rubber coating has worn thin and the tips of the a few fingers have developed small holes (see photos). It seems to me that the rubber coating could have been thicker and/or more durable (but then maybe that would make them less flexible and comfortable).
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: great glove
customer_reviews.text: I work at the airport at LAX moving and handling a lot of mail and containers, where one needs to wear gloves 100 percent of the time. Gloves keep hands clean and warm during night shift. very comfortable really excellent grip. I believe the XL is great for my small hands perfect product. The guys at work like the gloves, that I wear I am trying a lot gloves seeing which ones work great well the pine tree bamboo work great. thank for a great product. I will be getting more soon
customer_reviews.author: Playmaker

customer_reviews.title: Not for Pulling up Weeds
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these gloves and have used them numerous times outside digging, pulling out weeds, general outdoors work, but unfortunately I don't feel they withstood the vigors of use. Already have a hole in the right glove after about two weeks of on and off yard work and weed pulling. The use of your fingers pulling weeds is a lot. The gloves should gave reinforcements at the tips for this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So awesome I bought another pair
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves for gardening because I feel like I'm gardening with my bare hands. I have all the dexterity I need. However, if working with water at all, even wet soil, your hands will get wet. These are thin, fabric gloves. The fingers are partially covered in the black water-resistant material, but only one side, not covering your fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Stepharoo

customer_reviews.title: No Sweat!
customer_reviews.text: Can't recommend these gloves enough. FINALLY gloves that actually fit a woman's hand. I don't have particularly small hands-they're 'medium'- but the Small size fits wonderfully snug with no annoying excess length in the fingers, which is what you need for more precision jobs. Secondly, the nitirile coating is durable. Most importantly, the bamboo material is OUTSTANDING for keeping your hands dry. Most gardening gloves are synthetic and leave your hands hot & sweaty. Bravo for bamboo!
customer_reviews.author: Soccermom

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite garden gloves. I've tried cheaper ones but those only last for one season. This is my second season using these gloves and they have held up well and are very comfortable to wear. If they get muddy, I just hose them off. They are waterproof on the palm side, but the upper fabric isn't, so I have a different pair of gloves for when I want something totally waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable! But strong odor
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. They work well. My fingers do seem to get wet though any time I touch something that has water on it, so they aren't very waterproof, in my opinion. They also came out of the package with a very strong odor. It did not disappear after a few days either. I've used these quite often over this quarantine break and they have held up well. The smell disappeared over time. I just washed these gardening gloves in the washing machine today and they held up well.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening gloves
customer_reviews.text: Just acquired my second pair of Pine Tree Bamboo Working Gloves. Because I have finger nails just a bit above the tip of my fingers one of the middle fingers of the glove made a small hole. I still wear the gloves because they grip my mower handles well, fit just right. Stay on my hands--no slipping off. Very comfortable. I have the second pair as back up. Because they will not keep me warm when snow shoveling I will have to good to my woolies but the rest of the time I only want my Pine Trees. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Prinny

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great gloves. My husband and I both use them. I am glad I purchased them early to use during the pandemic times. Will buy again if I need to and they are available. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey F. W. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These are great for every thing from moving cinderblocks to pulling weeds. I have been very durable, no where in tear on the rubber part. They are still nice and snug like the day I got them. I’ve been using for two months.
customer_reviews.author: H. Hardman

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting glove that gives excellent feel
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of gardening gloves. Buy a bit smaller size than you think you need and it stretches to fit.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Among the Best Gloves Available
customer_reviews.text: Although bare hand sensitivity would be too high a claim, these gloves do afford nearly bare hand dexterity-- as when one needs to loosen fine, crock-bound roots while planting out. Further, hands stay cool, the rubber on the palms and fingers allows for using a touch screen, and the gloves last 1.5 to 2 years with proper care.
customer_reviews.author: Neptis

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for slightly over a month. I use them while gardening. As shown in my photo, a hole wore through the right index finger. The coating is cracking and wearing away everywhere. It’s nice that I can use my phone while wearing gloves, but they just have no integrity. Also, they are not even close to being water resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Katie K

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, comfortable, durable.
customer_reviews.text: So comfortable. I really can pull weeds, even strands of grass from between the sedum, with these gloves on. Now my skin and nails don't get all dried out and cracked from being in the dirt all season. A little dirt comes through, but by and large, my skin and nails are spared. Water goes right through, though, which isn't bad, just surprised me the first time. I have used them for a whole season, and they are working out well, still in fine shape. Not much difference in size between Medium and Large. I bought one of each and I almost can't tell the difference between them.
customer_reviews.author: tinyNorman

customer_reviews.title: A+ for control, durability and comfort
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 pairs of these gloves to work on a few gardens in Boston suburbs. My brother and I love these gloves. They're so much better than the ones that we'd picked up at Home Depot. These fit snug to the hand and make control and grip so much better. They're tough - I've had one set of gloves rip at the tips whereas these gloves are still in great condition. For dealing with plants with large thorns, I'd use special doubly thick gloves but for all other everyday weeding and gardening, these are the go-to gloves in our home!
customer_reviews.author: Gaby at Starting Fresh blog

customer_reviews.title: Breathable, comfortable and great dexterity and grip
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves my hands don’t sweat after working in them for a few and I often wear these underneath heavy rubber gloves to keep my hands from getting all sweaty and stinky. They don’t hold up to washing or water exposure so well and will lose grip of washed but I’ve bought multiple pairs over the years for myself and friends and all who own them seem to appreciate the comfort and breathability of these gloves
customer_reviews.author: lahita

customer_reviews.title: Love'em ... except,
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are super comfortable and the rubber coating is very water resistant. My hand size fit in between two sizes, and per the recommendation in their "Size Chart" I purchased the smaller size for a snug fit. That was a mistake ... at least for me. The smaller size is really snug and as you can see in my photo the rubber coating couldn't take it in between my thumb and index finger, and tore out. They are still very usable, but the next pair will be a size larger.
customer_reviews.author: jusdane

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: After 2 hours of working in the garden, these gloves are already coming apart. Update: To the seller's credit, I received a replacement pair of gloves. However, the replacement pair began coming apart after less than 3 hours using a hoe in the garden. IMO, these gloves are not worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Taosmax

customer_reviews.title: Blisters in 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves fit nicely and you do have a better feel for what you are working with. I tried these out after my leather garden gloves got a bit stinky. Ten minutes of pulling out vinka vine and I had giant blisters on my pinky, ring and middle fingers. Wrapped my blisters in bandaids and switched back to the stinky leather gloves. I’d rather have stinky hands than blisters. I’ll keep these gloves to help me open jars. Thats about it.
customer_reviews.author: Wren

customer_reviews.title: Best gardening gloves.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves came to me as a gift from my daughter, she spotted them on a search. I have used them and only recently washed them. While they were drying I thought to order a pair, as an extra. I can report that the washed gloves came out well but the two pair give me options for working throughout the day, even taking them off for lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne Ferrell Neal

customer_reviews.title: Best gloves for petite hands
customer_reviews.text: Finally a pair of yard gloves that fit my hands like..well, a glove. You have no idea how much easier yard work can be until you find a snug pair of gloves. Made raking leaves as painless as possible (for my hands anyway). Also encourages me to pull out any weeds I see or trim some hedges, clean my gutters...basically this pair of gloves has substantially increased my productivity. I love these. My only qualm is that a thorn once got stuck on the top side (which is unprotected) and was poking my finger and it hurt. So pull thorns with great caution, or buy thorn gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Apples and bananas

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I wore these gloves to garden this past weekend. Although I love how they feel and look, the black covering over one of my fingers has a tiny hole already. Much like the material lifted. Not a punctured hole. I wore them one day for several hours of weeding and they didn't hold up. I am quite disappointed in this. I purchased 2 pairs so that I could keep one in the shed and one near the house.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Broke these gloves in last weekend doing some intense yard work*, the gloves were comfortable and kept my hands from getting torn up and the gloves themselves held up like it was nothing. My hands also weren't as sweaty as they have been with other gloves, which cut down the blistering. I'll be wearing them again this weekend as I resume the yard work. *Yard work here included hacking through Stephen King novel creeper vine, weeds, cutting small tree limbs, pruning, raking, gathering fallen branches....these gloves will see me through my determination to complete this summer project.
customer_reviews.author: DoomYrd

customer_reviews.title: Average size hand for adult male - XXL is too small
customer_reviews.text: I initially ordered a large-sized glove because that's the size of vinyl glove I wear at work in the health-care industry. They were too small, so I sent them back and order an XL. That was too small, too, so I sent it back and ordered an XXL. Still too small! These gloves are probably very functional for whom they fit, but I am not one of those people.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Turnbloom

product_meta.title: Pine Tree Tools Bamboo Working Gloves for Women and Men. Ultimate Barehand Sensitivity Work Glove for Gardening, Fishing, Clamming, Restoration Work & More. S, M, L, XL, XXL (1 Pack M)…
feature_bullets: BREATHABLE BAMBOO TO KEEP YOUR HANDS COOL – Bamboo absorbs perspiration, is naturally very breathable. Keeps your hands cool in summer and warm in winter. Pine Tree Gloves are suitable for any job and guaranteed a pleasure to wear.

FITS LIKE A SECOND SKIN - Do you take off your gloves for every chore that requires finger sensitivity? Pine Tree Gloves have bare hand sensitivity and are Touchscreen friendly! Now you can make those reminders on your smart phone or ipad without taking your gloves off! Fishermen also love the grip on those slippery fish and the protection when changing hooks!

COMFORTABLE AND DURABLE HAND PROTECTION - We believe gardening should be safe and fulfilling. Avoid skin wounds and dirty hands and nails when doing yard chores. Why walking around with those thick and clumsy gloves while doing jobs around the house? How much more enjoyable would garden chores be, when you wear protective gloves with a snug fit? See our listed size chart picture on the left to determine your correct size. Our gloves have proven abrasion resistance.

PURE SATISFACTION OR MONEY BACK – Although our gloves are initially designed for gardening, many enjoy them during construction and restoration work, fishing trips and lobster diving! Are you not entirely satisfied in the end? Our product comes with a full satisfaction promise!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,739 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
